results.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
results.reason: This verse identifies Christ as the Word, affirming His divine nature and eternal existence.
results.reflection: Christ is the eternal Word, fully divine and present from the beginning.

results.text: The Son is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn over all creation.
results.reason: It highlights Christ's role as the visible representation of God and His preeminence.
results.reflection: In Christ, we see the fullness of God revealed to humanity.

results.text: Jesus answered, 'I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.'
results.reason: This passage declares Christ as the exclusive path to God, embodying truth and life.
results.reflection: Christ is the sole gateway to true life and eternal fellowship with God.

results.text: Who, being in very nature God, did not consider equality with God something to be used to his own advantage; rather, he made himself nothing by taking the very nature of a servant, being made in human likeness.
results.reason: These verses portray the humility and incarnation of Christ, emphasizing His servanthood.
